definition: to amend a judgment/to overrule the original decision/to commute (a sentence)

sentences.english: And in the second instance it was eventually changed to five-year imprisonment owing to the public opposing voice.
sentences.chinese: 后终在舆论的压力下，二审改判为5年有期徒刑。

sentences.english: Due to different angles, there might be overrules , please don't mind.
sentences.chinese: 比赛中有时改判，请大家不要介意，角度不同嘛。

sentences.english: With these principles in mind, Obama should commute Pollard's sentence to time served.
sentences.chinese: 信守这一原则，奥巴马应该改判波拉德的刑期。

definition: judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
to assess punishment/to determine the sentence (on a criminal)
to protest against a verdict/to lodge an appeal
to reduce penalty/shortened or commuted (judicial) sentence
to pronounce a sentence (after a verdict in a court of law)
deferred death sentence/commuted death sentence with forced labor and judicial review after two years (PRC) (legal)
